definition: secret purse/secret stash of money
personal/private/selfish
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
surname Fang
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
surname Qian

sentences.english: That's such a beautiful dress. I'm tempted to use some of my mad money and buy it.
sentences.chinese: 那件衣服太漂亮了，我真想用一些私房錢買下它。

sentences.english: But all in a word, I firmly oppose saving cash dough.
sentences.chinese: 總之，我堅決反對存私房錢。

sentences.english: Later that month she used her play money to buy a piece of bumble gum.
sentences.chinese: 後來她用私房錢賬戶裏的錢買了一塊口香糖。

sentences.english: "Mad Money" great harm, must not be allowed to spread.
sentences.chinese: “私房錢”危害很大，絕不能任其滋生蔓延。

sentences.english: I save some egg money for the newest-PSP.
sentences.chinese: 我想買最新的遊戲機，所以存了點私房錢。

sentences.english: My wife and I each receive our own play money, and here’s the best part.
sentences.chinese: 太太和我都有自己的私房錢，這一點最好了。

sentences.english: Two people come up with their own money donated a hope primary school.
sentences.chinese: 兩人拿出自己的私房錢捐助了一所希望小學。

sentences.english: Maybe he will give you some surprise with his egg money.
sentences.chinese: 也許有天他會用私房錢給你個驚喜呢。

sentences.english: My father sometimes squirrels some money away before he gives his salary to my mom.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸有時會在將薪水交給我媽媽之前偷藏私房錢。

definition: spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
exactly what one wants
ability/skill
lit. small abacus/fig. selfish calculations/bean-counting
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
trivial matter/a piece of cake
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
